channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for SC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for SC

item.title: Report E-2024050332
item.description:
Report E-2024050332

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-20T15:12:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-09
  • City: WEST COLUMBIA
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 9, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of NA1993 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately 75-gallons of product to the dock floor and pavement. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized eight (8) 55-gallon drums. The remaining product in the damaged tote was transferred into a new tote.
